org.zaproxy.zap.spider
Interface SpiderListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
SpiderAPI, SpiderThread
public interface SpiderListener

The listener interface for receiving spider related events. The class that is interested in processing a spider event implements this interface, and the object created with that class is registered with a component using the component's addSpiderListener method. When the spider event occurs, that object's appropriate method is invoked.

Method Summary

Method Detail

spiderProgress

void spiderProgress(int percentageComplete,
                    int numberCrawled,
                    int numberToCrawl)
Event triggered when the Spider progress has changed.

Parameters:
percentageComplete - the percentage complete
numberCrawled - the number of pages crawled
numberToCrawl - the number of pages left to crawl

foundURI

void foundURI(String uri,
              String method,
              FetchFilter.FetchStatus status)
Event triggered when a new uri was found. The status parameter says if the URI was skipped according to any skip rule or it was processed.

Parameters:
uri - the uri
method - the method used for accessing the uri
status - the FetchFilter.FetchStatus stating if this uri will be processed, and, if not, stating the reason of the filtering

readURI

void readURI(HttpMessage msg)
Event triggered when a new uri was read.

Parameters:
msg - the message

spiderComplete

void spiderComplete(boolean successful)
Event triggered when the spider is finished. This event is triggered either when the spider has completed scanning a website, in which case the parameter successful is true , either when it was stopped by an user in which case the successful parameter is false.

Parameters:
successful -
  • true - when the spider has scanned a website completely and finished by its own
  • false - when the spider was stopped by the user
